WADO Image Retrieval Service

Overview

Standards compliant implementation of the DICOM WADO specification (see Part 18: Web Access to DICOM Persistent Objects (WADO)). This implementation allows access to:
  • Images - the standard JPEG or other image format instances
  • Audio - streamed audio in a variety of standard web formats
  • Video - MPEG-2 video from DICOM containing MPEG-2 formatted data.
  • Reports - From structured reports and/or embedded PDF. May also have report sources from other systems with custom conversion to an HTML report.

FAQ

Content Types

The parameter contentType can choose the format of the returned objects. Some content types are incompatible with some arguments. The content type is comma-delimited, one of the available types will be chosen, with the first one listed being preferred.

Content Type Description Type
image/jpeg Returns a single image object in lossy JPEG format. Applies window levelling and other image operations. (default for images) Image
image/png Returns a lossless image object, with window levelling and other image operations. (default for overlay/pixel padding) Image
text/html Returns a browser-displayable HTML report or header for an object. (default for SR except SR that contains PDF) HTML
text/xml Returns an XML representation of the entire DICOM header. Fairly large and slow, but allows arbitrary XSL or other processing to be applied. XML
application/pdf Returns PDF from the DICOM header (default for this type of file) PDF
audio/basic Returns basic audio streams. Audio
video/mpeg2 Returns MPEG-2 containing DICOM objects as a video stream. Video
multipart/mime Returns objects as a streamed response, images and DICOM headers as seprarate objects, with overlays and pixel padding as PNG and regular images as JPEG 12 Multi
application/zip Same as multipart/mime in a streamed ZIP file instead. Multi
application/dicom Returns a DICOM file. DICOM

Parameters

Parameter Description Notes Types
requestType Defines the type of request to perform Required. Use WADO for this service
studyUID Constrain by the study UID of the requested study Recommended - some PACS systems require this, Impax Data Center is faster if the data is supplied All
seriesUID Constrain by the series UID of the requested series Recommended - some PACS systems require this, Impax Data Center is faster if the data is supplied All
objectUID Constrain by the object UID of the requested DICOM object Required except for multi-DICOM return values All
frameNumber If the DICOM object is a multi-frame, then the frame number is a required field. 1 based Image
rows Scale the image upto the indicated number of rows Image
columns Scale the image upto the indicated number of columns Image
windowWidth,

windowCenter

 Apply a specific window width/center to the returned image Image
presentaitonUID Apply a specific GSPS to the returned image Image
flip Set to true to invert the image Image
rotation Sets the rotation to use. Image
useOrig Return the raw, unchanged, no headers fixed DICOM file. DICOM
simpleFrameList A dash and comma separated list of frames to include in the DICOM DICOM
transferSyntax A backslash separated list of acceptable transfer syntaxes. Returns the raw encoding on disk if that is one of the transfer syntaxes, otherwise uses the first transfer syntax Supports no-pixel data and no-pixel data deflate. DICOM
help Whether to show this help message. Defaults to false All
